title: 'Recipient address must be specified' error when manually composing 'send' or 'request' message
body:
[comment]: # (Please replace ... with your information. Remove < and >)

### User Story

As a user, I want to transfer ETH by using the 'send' command.

### Description

[comment]: # (Feature or Bug? i.e Type: Bug)
*Type*: <Bug>

[comment]: # (Describe the feature you would like, or briefly summarise the bug and what you did, what you expected to happen, and what actually happens. Sections below)
*Summary*: When composing a '/send' command manually it gives you the right suggestions and looks the same as if you autocomplete '/send', but instead you get a 'recipient address must be specified' error.

#### Expected behavior
[comment]: # (Describe what you expected to happen.)
Transfer to happen or "insufficient funds..." error.

#### Actual behavior
[comment]: # (Describe what actually happened.)
 'recipient address must be specified' error.

### Reproduction
[comment]: # (Describe how we can replicate the bug step by step.)

- Open Status
- Chat with Jarrad
- Type "/send", click Jarrad, write 1, press enter
- Observe error

Compare:
- Type "/se", autocomplete by clicking suggestions, click Jarrad, write 1, press enter
- Transaction goes through or "insufficient funds" error.

### Solution
[comment]: # (Please summarise the solution and provide a task list on what needs to be fixed.)
*Summary*: 

- [ ] Same behavior for send regardless if you type "/send" manually or not
- [ ] Don't show transaction amount suggestion if address hasn't been parsed

### Additional Information
* Status version: latest develop
* Operating System: <Android> (simulator)

#### Logs

[comment]: # (if on Android please replicate bug whilst running adb 

Video: https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B9qqS9eU_SdpWi0wTkR0ZmhUeWs/view?usp=sharing
https://gist.github.com/oskarth/50d20ff10e52043d129487974699d058

Preliminary investigation shows two different code paths being hit when the UI suggests they should be essentially the same.

1) Good case: `/sen` and press `/send` suggestion to autocomplete
2) Bad case: `/sen` and press `d` then `space`

In the good case, we hit select-chat-input-command which clears the bot db.

## Event logs

```
GOOD CASE:
Handling re-frame event:  :select-chat-input-command
CHAT-INPUT-CMD, WILL CLEAR BOT DB
Handling re-frame event:  :set-chat-input-text
Handling re-frame event:  :clear-bot-db
Handling re-frame event:  :set-chat-input-metadata
Handling re-frame event:  :set-chat-ui-props
Handling re-frame event:  :load-chat-parameter-box
Handling re-frame event:  :chat-input-focus
Handling re-frame event:  :update-suggestions
Handling re-frame event:  :set-chat-ui-props
Handling re-frame event:  :set-expandable-height
Handling re-frame event:  :set-chat-ui-props
Handling re-frame event:  :update-text-selection
Handling re-frame event:  :set-chat-ui-props
Handling re-frame event:  :load-chat-parameter-box
:call-jail :jail-id 0x0428c9d6c1aaaa8369a7c63819684f30e34396dc0907d49afeac85a0a774ccb919b3482097d992e66bcc538e7a0c6acf874c77748f396f53c0a102e10d1a37765b
:call-jail :path [:commands "send" :params 0 :suggestions]
:call-jail :params {:parameters {:args (), :bot-db nil, :seq-arg nil}, :context {:data nil, :from "50b1bf979b9d5b13efeee623e0a0102b45abf200", :to "323a7fd769a0f106d6b41232b10c44064bb4be88"}}
{:result {:context {}, :messages [], :returned {:markup ["choose-contact" {:bot-db-key "recipient", :index 0, :title "Choose recipient"}], :title "Send transaction"}}}
Handling re-frame event:  :received-bot-response
****SUGG HANDLER DB [recv-bot-resp]
nil
Handling re-frame event:  :suggestions-handler
Handling re-frame event:  :choose-predefined-expandable-height
Handling re-frame event:  :set-in
Handling re-frame event:  :set-expandable-height
Handling re-frame event:  :set

BAD CASE:
Handling re-frame event:  :check-sync
Handling re-frame event:  :update-sync-state
Handling re-frame event:  :set
Handling re-frame event:  :set-chat-input-text
Handling re-frame event:  :update-input-data
Handling re-frame event:  :update-suggestions
Handling re-frame event:  :update-text-selection
Handling re-frame event:  :set-chat-ui-props
Handling re-frame event:  :load-chat-parameter-box
Handling re-frame event:  :set-chat-ui-props
Handling re-frame event:  :set-expandable-height
Handling re-frame event:  :set-chat-ui-props

[press space]

Handling re-frame event:  :load-chat-parameter-box
Handling re-frame event:  :update-input-data
Handling re-frame event:  :update-suggestions
Handling re-frame event:  :update-text-selection
Handling re-frame event:  :set-chat-ui-props
Handling re-frame event:  :load-chat-parameter-box
:call-jail :jail-id 0x0428c9d6c1aaaa8369a7c63819684f30e34396dc0907d49afeac85a0a774ccb919b3482097d992e66bcc538e7a0c6acf874c77748f396f53c0a102e10d1a37765b
:call-jail :path [:commands "send" :params 0 :suggestions]
:call-jail :params {:parameters {:args (), :bot-db nil, :seq-arg nil}, :context {:data nil, :from "50b1bf979b9d5b13efeee623e0a0102b45abf200", :to "323a7fd769a0f106d6b41232b10c44064bb4be88"}}
Handling re-frame event:  :set
Handling re-frame event:  :set-chat-ui-props
{:result {:context {}, :messages [], :returned {:markup ["choose-contact" {:bot-db-key "recipient", :index 0, :title "Choose recipient"}], :title "Send transaction"}}}
Handling re-frame event:  :received-bot-response
****SUGG HANDLER DB [recv-bot-resp]
nil
Handling re-frame event:  :suggestions-handler
Handling re-frame event:  :choose-predefined-expandable-height
Handling re-frame event:  :set-in
Handling re-frame event:  :set-expandable-height
Handling re-frame event:  :set
Handling re-frame event:  :check-sync
Handling re-frame event:  :update-sync-state
```

There seems to be something going on with stale state in a `default-db` key. When changing the value to send to someone the `:to` field is getting reset:

```
BAD CASE:
*** :received-bot-response
 {:to "0x323a7fd769a0f106d6b41232b10c44064bb4be88", :value "0x0"}
*** :received-bot-response
 {:to "0x323a7fd769a0f106d6b41232b10c44064bb4be88", :value "0xde0b6b3a7640000"}
*** :received-bot-response
 {:to nil, :value "0xde0b6b3a7640000"}

GOOD CASE:
*** :received-bot-response
 {:to "0x323a7fd769a0f106d6b41232b10c44064bb4be88", :value "0x0"}
*** :received-bot-response
 {:to "0x323a7fd769a0f106d6b41232b10c44064bb4be88", :value "0xde0b6b3a7640000"}
*** :received-bot-response
 {:to "0x323a7fd769a0f106d6b41232b10c44064bb4be88", :value "0xde0b6b3a7640000"}
```

Pausing on this one for a while as it isn't part of the immediate milestone.

Same happens for /request command typed manually 
Bad case: /reques and press t then space
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.
This issue has been automatically closed. Please re-open if this issue is important to you.
